ratings.comment: Algebra II is extremely hard class that covers a bunch of materials, but Prof Mundinger managed to cover every subject very clearly. The midterm is poorly deigned because nobody had enough time, but he ended up offering to replace it with the final, which is perfect in difficulty. Overall a solid and understanding professor.

Very good professor for first UW Madison Math class. Really prepared me for the 500 level classes like 521, 541, and 551. It was a very information-dense class and we went quickly at times, but he published written lecture notes which you could look at after class. All in all, amazing professor who loves his craft. Would take any class with him

Mundinger is ehhh. His lectures are really sophisticated and he speaks very professionally. The lectures and homeworks are all in-depth proof based but the tests have some computational problems (which he doesn't directly teach). His grading is very rigorous. Overall, if you a hardcore lin alg course, go with him, otherwise, go with someone else.

This was a difficult class, but I learned a lot! Dr. Mundinger responded quickly to questions on Piazza, and his lecture notes were very helpful. The homeworks were proof-based, which was a struggle, but the expectations on how to write proofs were clear, and Dr. Mundinger helped me improve my proofs in office hours.

An awesome professor; clearly passionate. Lectures were a dry at times but that could be because the curriculum was basic. He spiced things up at times with the linear algebra cookbook. He was very clear and the exams were well-constructed. However, for those genuinely passionate about math, I'd recommend 341 over this class, as it was quite basic.

Dr. Mundinger speaks clearly and it is clear he cares about teaching. His lectures can sometimes be dry but I ultimately noticed his passion about linear algebra. I am a math major and his way of teaching fit my learning style, but others may not like the theorem, definition structure. Exams were easy conceptually but arithmetic heavy.

Had a funny personality which helped keep the material fresh, and he did a good job of connecting current topics to stuff from previous chapters. Lecture notes aren't posted until the end of each chapter, but you are much better served going to lecture itself--even after missing just two, I had to work for weeks to catch up conceptually.
lectures aren't that heplful, not recorded either. had to refer to friend's prof's notes and recorded lectures before exams. class isn't hard in general.

Near 80% of the grade is toward exams, which is too much. I would say to include a group project for a grade booster and to lower the weight of exams. Now, with the professor his lectures were so boring and hard to follow. Just had to wait for reviews for past exams to come out so that you could actually understand how to do the problems.
Decent lectures; material wasn't too challenging, but it wasn't a cakewalk either.

Joshua was the driving factor as to why I enjoyed this class. He was quick to figure out a new way to explain concepts if there was confusion, and sprinkled in some fun personality to the class which made lectures go by fast.
